attributes.action: Public enquiry into DEFRA's handling of Bird Flu 2016/17
attributes.background: Defra have failed to provide timely, clear & consistent info to poultry keepers and the general public throughout the prevention zone and outbreak period.
attributes.additional_details: The law relating to lockdown requirements is vague.  Defra/Apha/Trading Standards representatives are issuing conflicting information when questions have been raised. The general public have received minimal information via the media, any information has been actively sought by those with online access and a passing knowledge of the situation. We (the public) have many questions that require clear answers.

attributes.action: Stop non-medically qualified persons administering dermal filler.
attributes.background: The aesthetics industry is poorly regulated and the number of non-medics offering dermal filler injections in the UK is growing rapidly. Concern lies mainly with theses individual's ability to assess appropriately as well as recognise and manage complications as and when they arise.
attributes.additional_details: Health professionals in the U.K are concerned about the growing number of non-medics offering dermal filler injections. Anyone can train, get insurance and start injecting members of the public with these substances. There are substantial risks associated with these treatments and whilst doctors and nurses are regulated by their own professional bodies, non-medics are not. They are not regulated or professionally accountable.

attributes.action: Increase awareness and services for those suffering from eating disorders
attributes.background: We the undersigned ask that the government both develop greater awareness and increase funding to mental health services for those suffering from an eating disorder.
attributes.additional_details: We are a group of students from the University of Exeter campaigning to raise awareness of the lack of support for sufferers of eating disorders, particularly in the South West.

attributes.action: Make All Highway Contracts Fix Pot Holes Within 150 Meters Of Active Roadworks.
attributes.background:
We are all sick of hitting pot holes and getting stuck or slowed down by roadworks. 

We want to make it law that any company who closes off a highway , must repair any pothole within 150 meters of the closure.

attributes.action: State Pension Payable Immediately On Completion Of 40 Years N.I. Contributions
attributes.background: Recent State Pension changes means many people will contribute around 50 years N.I contributions before they will receive a State Pension, despite the Government themselves saying 35 years is the amount of contributions needed to create it in the first place.     Pay the pension at 40 years maximum.
attributes.additional_details: If your employer say they will pay you £10 per hour for a fifty hour week, then you only receive £350, you'd feel a little more than a little miffed - but that's exactly the "deal" we are being sold by the Government with increased retirement ages.     By their own admission, you need to pay N.I. contributions for 35 years to get a full State Pension.     So why are we expected to work longer?     Any individual completing 40 years contributions should have their pension payable from that point.

attributes.action: To excempt special guardians from this ruthless benefit cap.
attributes.background: Special guardians protect vulnerable children and often cannot work due to caring for these children saving them from foster care, saving the system thousands.This benefit cap is heartless towards many children and (previously looked after children and the families who care for them.  STOP THIS CAP!
attributes.additional_details: Guardians are excempt from this cap but not special guardians.... guardians are guardians both are raising children until 18 and both situations very traumatic for these children and being raised and cared for by others not birth parents. The new welfare reform has financially put us at risk! The goverment say work or we cut your money! Many can't work and have had to give up employment as many of these children have issues and need us. Should special guardians be going to A FOOD BANK??

attributes.action: Throw out plans requiring voters to produce ID at polling stations
attributes.background: The UK government has announced plans to trial asking voters to produce ID before being allowed to vote. If this law was to be passed then it will be unfairly affecting the poor, the marginalised, the homeless, the isolated and the most vulnerable sections of our society. It needs to be stopped.

attributes.action: Stop passport checks on pregnant NHS patients
attributes.background: The proposals by St. George's University Hospital Trust, and backed by the Home Office, that pregnant people would be subject to mandatory passport checks before being able to access care to crack down on "health tourism" are deeply worrying, steeped in racism, and should be rejected immediately.
attributes.additional_details: Antenatal wards already require a form with proof of eligibility but these cannot always be done fully. The proposals would require checks to be stricter and could, in the view of multiple critics and medical staff, lead to higher risk to patient health. These proposals give no assurance that patients would have access to care regardless of immigration status, as is current government policy and law. Focus on "health tourism" is a racist smokescreen for the Conservatives' destruction of the NHS.

attributes.action: Grant children immediate access to life saving drug.
attributes.background:
NHS England have today announced that all early access programmes regarding Nusinersen will be put on hold. They want to open just 5 centres accross the country, this takes time. Time is something many SMA children don't have. 
Please join me in asking NHS England to reverse this decision.
attributes.additional_details:
Nusinersen is the only known treatment of SMA, it is not a miracle cure, however it gives children time and a better quality of life. 
Spinal Muscular Atrophy, what's that you might ask. A month ago I wouldn't have known my self. 
It's an evil disease that effectively makes your child waste away. Their muscles waste until eventually they suffer respiratory failure, the whole time their brain unaffected.

attributes.action: Urge Volkswagen to compensate owners of cars with emission defeat devices
attributes.background: In the US, Volkswagen have to pay $5100 to each owner affected and the owners get the option of buyback by Volkswagen of the vehicle or to wait for VW to develope a fix that can win regulatory approval.
attributes.additional_details: Emission "defeat devices" are a software Volkswagen knowingly installed in its cars to fool emission testing machines into thinking that the car is safer than it is. The software actually allows the cars affected to emit up to 40 times the legally allowable pollution, whilst cheating at the MOT emission test so that it passes. The scandal has also damaged the resale value of affected cars and as such I think it a travesty that Volkswagen do not pay compensation to owners

attributes.action: Make breeding animals without a licence a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Each year "ALMOST 50,000 pet dogs are being dumped by owners in Britain every year – with healthy animals being exterminated every TWO hours by agencies who are struggling to cope".  "Authorities killed 5,142 stray dogs last year as Britain's abandoned pet crisis shows little sign of being solved".
attributes.additional_details: If animals weren't so readily available to buy on the internet/private sales, if demand was far greater than the supply thus prices weren't so competitive/affordable then people wouldn't be so quick to buy one and be so irresponsible and careless once they become pet owners.  I would like licensed breeders ONLY to sell pets in order for the government to have better control over the pet population/welfare,  and a better approach to who animals are sold to, some form of vetting would be ideal.

attributes.action: BRING BACK THE NIT NURSE
attributes.background: We all know that the little critters are at large within schools. But they have got significantly worse over recent years. Bringing back the nit nurse would give those parents who don't regularly check their children's hair the extra push they need.
attributes.additional_details: It is unfair on all children involved. I myself have had to treat my daughter 3 times in the 2 weeks she's been back at school. This is almost abuse. Let's help all people involved.

attributes.action: Make it Compulsory for Bus/Taxi Road lanes Surfaces be Colour Coded
attributes.background: Don't you hate it when you're away from home in unfamiliar surroundings then drive down a Bus/Taxi Land not knowing because it's not displayed properly then getting a fine.
attributes.additional_details: Get road surface colour coded where necessary

attributes.action: Stop the NHS wasting more time in the courts: Commission PrEP immediately.
attributes.background: PrEP stands for Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis. It's a course of HIV drugs for HIV negative people to take before sex to reduce their risk of contracting HIV. Research demonstrates that PrEP is as effective as condoms in preventing HIV transmission.
attributes.additional_details:
In March 2016 NHS England stated that they were 'not responsible for commissioning PrEP’. Following a legal challenge from the National AIDS Trust, which the NHS wasted time and money appealing, the Court of Appeal has ruled that the NHS has the legal power to fund PrEP. 

The NHS’s decision has already been delayed for over 6 months, so we urgently call on Jeremy Hunt to make PrEP available on the NHS. 

Every day the NHS delays its decision, 17 more people will be diagnosed with HIV.

attributes.action: Form a Home or National Defence Force of HM Forces Veterans.
attributes.background: There are thousands of able and willing HM Forces Veterans who would step forward if required to form a Home or National Defence Force to assist in Border Protection or assistance to Police and regular Forces in times of emergency, or civil unrest.
attributes.additional_details: These Veterans are a valuable asset to this Nation, well trained, experienced and able to fulfill tasks and roles during times of emergency or civil unrest.

attributes.action: Extend the Animal Welfare Act 2006 to include crustaceans
attributes.background:
Crustaceans are not covered by existing animal welfare legislation. 
The Animal Welfare Act 2006 states that its protection can be extended to other types of animals if it can be proven that they are capable of experiencing pain.
Scientific evidence proves that crustaceans do feel pain.
attributes.additional_details:
There is much scientific evidence to suggest that crustaceans feel pain.
As crustaceans are not in the animal welfare act, they can be killed in any way. This usually involves boiling them or hacking them to pieces whilst they are still alive. 
Animal welfare organisations are calling for greater protection for these animals, based on sound scientific evidence and the provision in the Act.
Reference: RSPCA, Animal Aid and Shellfish network

attributes.action: Allow parliament to vote on whether or not we stay within the single market
attributes.background: People voted for brexit thinking it would be done in an orderly fashion with an input from everyone in parliament, not by a committee created by an unelected prime minister. Brexit should be done with everyone in mind, no one asked for a crippled pound and a damage to the economy.
attributes.additional_details: The European Single Market enables free trade within the EU, helping 26 million UK businesses and access to a market worth over £9 trillion. Membership of the single market would allow us to enjoy the same trade benefits and support British companies even after we have left the EU. Continued tariff-free trade will preserve confidence in the British economy, but with Theresa May's current plan, it would require leaving the block, our economy will go down and the working/middle class will suffer.

attributes.action: All Government forms, publications in English or English/Welsh languages only.
attributes.background:
All Government forms and publications should be printed in English or English/Welsh languages only.
The public sector is estimated to spend  140 million a year on translation services.
attributes.additional_details:
Local councils spend at least £25m; the police £21m; the courts system spends more than £10m without accounting for the cost of legal aid; and the NHS - a conservative estimate is £55m.
The Human Rights Act only requires translation if someone is arrested or charged with a criminal offence.
Translating is not only expensive it is doing harm because it reinforces the language barrier which separates communities from the rest of Britain and hinders integration.

attributes.action: Recognise non-binary people legally
attributes.background: We would like those who identify as non-binary, genderqueer, gender non conforming, or any other similar identity to be recognised in the eyes of British law.
attributes.additional_details: Recognising us legally means that the discrimination against non binary individuals will be reduced, as anti-discriminatory laws can be enforced to prosecute people illegally targeting us- this will also act as a deterrent for other people who discriminate on the grounds of gender identity and expression.

attributes.action: Start teaching children in schools about mental health
attributes.background:
In schools children are taught about sex education but never about mental health - why not? 

Large percentages of the population are affected by mental illness themselves or are subject to it some way. Make sure people are aware of warning signs/symptoms from a young age in order to help others.
attributes.additional_details: 10% of children and young people (aged 5-16 years) have a clinically diagnosable mental problem, yet 70% of children and adolescents who experience mental health problems have not had appropriate interventions at a sufficiently early age. (https://www.mentalhealth.org.uk/statistics/mental-health-statistics-children-and-young-people)

attributes.action: Reverse the mortgage interest tax relief restriction on ‘individual’ landlords.
attributes.background:
The government will curb the amount of tax landlords can claim back on their property investments, meaning buying and renting out property may no longer be viable for many.
This will result in some landlords who finance their business with mortgages paying tax despite making no profit.
attributes.additional_details:
The policy discriminates against individual buy-to-let investors by denying them the same rights as other business owners.'
In no other business are costs wholly incurred to fund the business liable for taxation.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to pay Govia Thameslink Railway £20m of Taxpayer Money
attributes.background:
Govia Thameslink Railway (GTR) has been granted a £20m fund to "get to grips" with problems on the Southern rail network.

GTR is jointly owned by Go-Ahead (2/3) and Keolis (1/3), who between them also hold the Southeastern and London Midland franchises.
attributes.additional_details:
On 2nd September 2016, Go-Ahead announced full-year profits (y/e 2nd July 2016) of £99.8m, an increase of 26.8% over the previous financial year.

Parliament should debate whether the payment of £20m can be justified in light of the demonstrated profitability of Go-Ahead, or whether a private enterprise should fund the improvements to its service from cash on deposit and profits.

If GTR cannot or will not fund the improvements to services, it should consider resigning its franchises.

attributes.action: Legally define a single agreed definition for ‘vegetarian’ or ‘vegan’.
attributes.background: Currently there is no single agreed definition for ‘vegetarian’ or ‘vegan’. This makes it difficult to legally require food businesses to provide information on the suitability of their products for vegetarian and vegan consumers.
attributes.additional_details: A previous petition was raised to make labeling food as vegetarian and/or vegan as a legal requirement, as many companies refuse to label their products as Vegetarian or vegan. A simple legal requirement for a label, would assist thousands of consumers to make smart choices.  The government's response confirmed that no single agreed definition makes it difficult to legally require food businesses to provide labeling.  A legal definition will assist in changing this.

attributes.action: Ensure the Royal Navy does not lose its long-range anti-ship missile capability
attributes.background:
The MoD has admitted that the Royal Navy's Harpoon anti-ship missile will go out of service in 2018 with no replacement specified. The shorter range Sea Skua missile also goes out of service, not to be replaced until 2020.

This means the Royal Navy will lack a ship-killing capability for sometime
attributes.additional_details:
Rear-Adml Chris Parry, said: "It's a significant capability gap and the Government is being irresponsible. It just shows that our warships are for the shop window and not for fighting."

Lord West of Spithead, a former First Sea Lord, said: “This is just another example of where the lack of money is squeezing and making the nation less safe. We will have this gap of several years without missiles. Well, that’s fine if you don’t have to fight anybody in the meantime.”

attributes.action: Give the CQC powers to regulate & inspect all Care recruitment agencies
attributes.background: Recruitment in care is becoming a huge issue, every provider now has a problem with agency use. There are enough staff out there but they are working for agencies rather than the regulated Care Homes and Hospitals. It is not a level playing field and staff are drawn to agencies that break the rules.
attributes.additional_details: Agencies don't have to register with the CQC if where they work is already registered. Staff are drawn to agency work as they employ immediately, often without DBS checks & let them work excessive hours in different homes. If we challenge them then they are just moved to another home. We as managers have to use them to fill gaps in our staffing but we wouldn't need to if they played by the same rules and staff were not drawn to quick unregulated employment. Charles G Sadler - Registered Manager

attributes.action: Regulate all Online Animal Rescue Groups
attributes.background: After a bad experience with an online animal rescue group, who illegally re-homed my cat, I learned of others who had difficulties with them. Animal suffering was also suggested. Anyone can set up an online rescue group; there are no premises; they need no licence; the RSPCA  find it hard to inspect
attributes.additional_details:
Animal Welfare legislation is out  of date:
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/animal-welfare-legislation-protecting-pets 
There is no legislation or governing body to check online rescue groups.
People need no prior animal rescue knowledge or experience to start a group. 
Immediately a group is set up they can ask for donations regardless of whether they are a registered charity or not. The groups are not accountable to anyone and nor are their financial records.
Many start off with good intent but cannot cope when they are inundated with animals and have a lack of funding.

attributes.action: Make chronic stomach/bowel conditions eligible for a disabled person's railcard
attributes.background: Many people who suffer from chronic stomach/bowel illnesses such as inflammatory bowel disease and irritable bowel syndrome will opt to use trains for long distance journeys, due to their accessible toilets, on demand. Due to the need for accessible toilets, we ask that sufferers receive a discount.
attributes.additional_details: Toilets are a major necessity for people who suffer from stomach/bowel conditions as they can be urgently needed at any time during a journey. This can prevent people from driving long journeys as service stations can often be few and far between. We ask that the government add chronic stomach/bowel illnesses to the list of conditions eligible for a disabled persons railcard. In some cases, people will choose a train journey instead of long car journeys to avoid embarrassment, anxiety and pain.

attributes.action: More NHS funding in mental health for armed forces veterans suffering with PTSD.
attributes.background: Many armed forces veterans are faced with harrowing and distressing circumstances in the line of duty.Organisations such as Salute in Burnley Lancashire provide support and counselling to Lancashire armed forces Veterans and are not funded appropriately.Veterans need our support.
attributes.additional_details: Services such as Salute in Burnley Lancashire provide support and counselling for armed forces veterans.In order to survive they need to be funded appropriately.This year they were given £20,000 less than the previous year and yet have a greater demand and an expanding waiting list.The demand for these services is high and the funding is lacking.Support our brave soldiers in the aftercare they deserve.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for restaurants to clearly label vegan options.
attributes.background: It's commonplace for vegetarian options in restaurants to be clearly labelled, but can be rather difficult to determine which options are vegan, and can lead to lengthy research and awkward conversations. I feel it's necessary as vegetarians can eat all vegan food but not vice-versa.

attributes.action: Keep RAF Halton open
attributes.background: The MOD are considering fully shutting down RAF Halton by 2022. Although this is in line with the ''Better Defence Estate' Strategy, which aims to contribute to the government's housing target, this site contains some on the UK's best RAF memorabilia and it would be a a shame to see this place gone.
attributes.additional_details: http://forces.tv/48967067

attributes.action: Government to debate epilepsy in 2017. We all need HM Government help.
attributes.background: We need MPs help to get epilepsy recognised and recognised in schools. Employers to understand and to place us all in jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
To date teachers, employees and the majority of the public fail to recognise what epilepsy is and how to deal with it. 

We are normal everyday people who in suffer from an illness. Please give us a chance in life.

attributes.action: Condemn Donald Trump's ban on Muslim refugees and immigrants.
attributes.background: Donald Trump has signed an executive order to close America’s borders to Muslim refugees and immigrants from Iraq, Syria, Iran, Yemen, Sudan, Libya and Somalia.This is even being applied to green card residents. We must use our influence to condemn this deeply divisive move.

attributes.action: Allow Foster Carers to Transfer without being subject to another lengthy process
attributes.background: I have been a Foster Carer for my local authority for the past five years. Over the last year I have become incredibly unhappy with the way in which the service has treated myself and other carers. We are unable to transfer to another agency without being subject to another full process.
attributes.additional_details: I have taken the time to speak to carers, some of whom have dedicated their whole lives to fostering. Many have shared with me that despite being unhappy they remain where they are as they could not face another full process at their time of life. They also feel that they are unable to share how they are feeling due to fear of being penalised by the local authority for example 'not placing children with them'. As carers we have no rights, please give us the right to transfer and be happy!

attributes.action: Increase verification to decrease the fraud in scrapping a stolen vehicle.
attributes.background:
Vehicles presented for scrapping by a thief can currently disappear if no V5 is presented on arrival at the scrapyard.
There is no electronic information or cross checking link between DVLA and police forces in the UK.
Remove the facility of cashing the cheque to the thief by the scrapyard.
attributes.additional_details: This follows an incident with a rare vehicle which after being stolen, disappeared, was effectively crushed, and all that happened before any checks could be made.

attributes.action: Keep the term "Honour Killing".
attributes.background:
Campaigners fought long and hard to get the term honour crimes recognised as a different form of abuse experienced by women within minority communities. 

Honour killings are different to domestic homicide, in the same way as domestic homicides are different to murder.
attributes.additional_details:
By likening honour killings to murder shows a clear lack of understanding of the complexities experienced by women from minority communities. 

Honour killings are different to domestic homicide, in the same way as domestic homicides are different to murder. 

This term honour killings acknowledges the complexities involved in these cases and the additional difficulties faced by the women experiencing these crimes. 

An example of this was the murder on Banaz Mahmod, where an entire community was silent following her murder, this is not the case in other cases of murder.

attributes.action: Referendum for Universal Basic Income, paid monthly for UK working age citizens.
attributes.background: It is an income paid to individuals, as a right of legal residence, without means testing or requirements to work. The payment is non taxable and should be sufficient to cover basic needs. This would provide a secure floor for people to build on, rather than a means tested benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
All sourced from this website:

http://www.basicincome.org.uk/reasons-support-basic-income

attributes.action: Ehler Danlos Syndrome NEEDS doctors knowledge! FUND IT!
attributes.background: Ehlers Danlos Syndrome has different types, the common link between them is Pain. Most people affected by this illness aren't diagnosed until later on in their lives.It is mostly an invisible illness and can ruin your life completely. THERE IS NO CURE! Most doctors don't know what it is.#makeachange
attributes.additional_details: I suffer from ehler danlos syndrome and life is hard at the best of times, when something goes wrong you would think a doctor to know at least a bit of background about it. NOT EDS! This is horrifying as so many people go undiagnosed and refused the help they need to manage it! Not all of us with EDS can make it to America for treatment so we need something set up to help people in the 🇬🇧. Every time a doctor says "i don't know what that is" it saddens me. Please help to change this😔

attributes.action: Ban the sale of vehicle/ van lock picks in the UK
attributes.background: In a new scandal, hundreds of vans are having their security systems bypassed by lock picks used by thieves. All doors are unlocked and the alarm turned off, so that thieves can relieve tradesmen of their hard earned tools, taking away their livelihood and taking food off tables.

attributes.action: Partition 7 new British Crown Dependencies out of UK and EU; keeping UK in EU.
attributes.background:
Partition 7 new British Crown Dependencies out of UK and EU so Leavers can Leave EU. Keep post-Partition UK a full EU member state (do not activate Art.50) so Remainers can Remain in EU.
Precedents: Isle of Man, Jersey & Guernsey are BCDs outside EU.
When Greenland left Denmark, Denmark stayed EU
attributes.additional_details:
Full Petition Text & Detailed List of the 7 new BCDs' areas (with % Leave vote figures): http://tinyurl.com/ntg88ta
Maps of 7 BCDs: 
http://tinyurl.com/orygvny 
http://tinyurl.com/ogb3qnk
Further:
UK Govt to assign finance & civil servants to help each of new BCDs get its Govt / Parliament set up.
Defence still by UK; major roads, rail, power grids & nuclear reactors stay UK territory; later on BCDs contribute finances. 
Reciprocal NHS Arrangement between BCDs & UK (like Isle of Man & UK now).

attributes.action: End the 'Special Relationship' with the USA in the event of a Trump presidency.
attributes.background: After 580,000 petitioned to ban his entry into the UK, Trump may become president. Our Special Relationship means the British people may be dragged into economic, political and military conflict by a hated man. In this time of vulnerability, the UK must distance itself from Trump's America.
attributes.additional_details: In a campaign mired in racism, xenophobia, extremism, and sexual assault, Donald Trump has outlined plans which, due to the US/UK 'Special Relationship', may endanger British citizens and interests. This includes nuclear proliferation in Korea and Japan, the abandonment of NATO, forcing Mexico to pay for a border wall, ground troops in Syria, torture, opposition to China, and potential war with Iran and North Korea. If Trump wins, the UK must take a stand against his administration.

attributes.action: Make it easier to remove bullies from schools, at any age and fine the parents
attributes.background: As a parent, i find it outrageous that there is so much 'red tape' surrounding schools and exclusions. A child has to be excluded for a total of 45 DAYS before a permanent exclusion is warranted. Most of these exclusions are related to VERY SERIOUS incidents, but why wait for so many to take place?
attributes.additional_details: Parents whose children are victims of bullying are forced to remove their children from education for their safety, either to be home schooled or a change of school. Both of which can be extremely difficult for most. Why should victims have to change their friends, schools, routines and sometimes homes all because of bullies? It's time the bullies and their parents families faced the consequences of their childrens behaviour- not the other way round.

attributes.action: Minimum sentences for police officers who lie while performing their duties.
attributes.background: Police officers swear an oath to act with the highest level of integrity. They choose to put themselves up as a beacon of virtue and honesty and believe their uniform sets them apart. They are placed above other members of society and are expected to act with honesty and integrity at all times.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent petition has been drafted requesting minimum sentencing for assaulting a police officer.

A police officer dons the uniform and in their own minds view themselves as different.

They rely on this difference when making statements that they know will be given more credence than contradictory statements made by "ordinary" members of the public.

The abuse of this power should be met with the full anger of the law they perverted.

attributes.action: Allow all high risk cancer patients to have annual check up scans nationwide.
attributes.background:
I would like patients at high risk of their cancer returning or at high risk of being diagnosed with metastatic cancer to have life saving annual check ups no matter where they live. 
At the moment this is a postcode lottery. 
Please sign my petition. 
It may save your life or a loved ones life.
attributes.additional_details:
My Name is Stacey. At the age of 26 I was given just weeks to live due to an aggressive form of ovarian cancer. I have two young children and I married my husband from my hospital bed.
After pioneering last resort radical surgery by Christina Fotopoulo my life was saved.
Despite the cancer being very likely to return and unlikely to be caught in time without regular scans I was horrified to discover that the NHS do not offer check up scans to all high risk patients like me. 
Help save a life.

attributes.action: Cover mental health under The Equality Act 2010
attributes.background: The Equality Act covers the same groups that were protected by existing equality legislation – age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership and pregnancy and maternity. These are now called ‘protected characteristics’.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 people in the UK will experience a mental health problem each year. Just because you cannot see a disability, which it is, doesn't mean it does not exist and should not be under the Equality Act 2010. They say it "can" be covered if there is proof it effects day to day life, but that is unacceptable as it can be hard to prove that. People all over the country suffer. Jobs, benefits, health all put strain on people where they cannot cope, mental health should be a protected characteristic.

attributes.action: Stop UK residents driving on foreign licences
attributes.background: The UK driving test is in place to ensure EVERY driver is safe to use our roads. But due to legislation EU/foreign drivers are able to drive for set periods/70years old on their countries licence. We MUST improve road safety, by ensuring EVERY driver living in UK undergoes OUR test.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2011 alone 80k licences were exchanged that's 80k people who have NEVER taken the UK test.
DVSA have clamped down on fraudulent tests, claiming 'the driving test is there to ensure all drivers have the skills & knowledge to use the roads safely & responsibly' 
This must be extended to truly ensure ALL drivers have this knowledge.

attributes.action: Make Public Transport Strike Action Illegal - Put in Alternative Dispute Process
attributes.background: The Southern Trains series of strikes has left the paying commuter helpless with no resolution in sight. The status quo is not working and it is unfair for the public to suffer and be a pawn in these disputes. Strike action should be illegal and an alternative dispute method sought.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-38296623

attributes.action: Establish Fibromyalgia clinics  to improve services for chronic pain in the Uk.
attributes.background: Fibromylgia is a chronic. syndrome affecting 1 in 20 of the population. Although it can be diagnosed easily by Rheumotologists,  GP's in local surgeries are often unable to make a diagnosis, or provide the level of medical care and support which is necessary .
attributes.additional_details:
Fibromyalgia is identified by pain in all 4 quadrants of the body, chronic fatigue and sleeping disorders. It is a complex condition involving many other symptoms from Irritable Bowel Syndrome, cognitive impairment, poor and poor co ordination to severe headaches ,Temporal Mandible Joint pain , and many others.
Providing clinics which run in a similar manner to diabetic clinics, would provide a higher standard of support for Fibromyalgia patients.These clinics are being trialled in some parts of the UK reducing trips to A and E departments,  clinic waiting times and the number of visits to a variety of other clinics.

attributes.action: Fund the promise: Priority NHS treatment for War Pension attributable injuries
attributes.background: Successive Governments have promised since 1948, that War Pensioners would receive priority treatment for attributable injuries caused by their Military Service. In 2008 The Govt issued guidelines to receive priority treatment. This promise, a duty of care, to Military Personnel must be upheld.
attributes.additional_details: In 2008 The Government issued guidelines stating that:  If you are in receipt of a war pension award, be it a gratuity (one off payment) or a weekly pension, you are entitled under an NHS Executive Guideline HSG(97)31 to receive priority treatment for the accepted conditions on your war pension. Also, in 2008, this guideline was extended to include conditions that are not accepted under your war pension but could be caused from your service in the Armed forces.  The NHS does not honour this.

attributes.action: Change the child tax credits from two children to four.
attributes.background: Lower income families and working families on low income need the extra help. Not many families have just two children and some people are now pregnant and at risk of miscarriage due to the stress of money worries.

attributes.action: Make all take-away and fast food outlets use compostable containers and cutlery.
attributes.background: I was inspired by the same ethos used at Glastonbury festival where all cutlery is wooden and the containers are made from expanded or blown cardboard, even when serving gravy. It will aid the recycling of food waste. We need to reduce the volume of plastics going to landfill.
